baseline_groups.claim_summary: Birth cohorts are larger in zodiac-auspicious years, indicating superstition-driven fertility timing in Vietnam.
baseline_groups.notes: Table 3 Column 1. OLS regression of log provincial birth cohort size on BorG (born in auspicious year indicator) with quadratic birth-year trend and robust SE. N=22 year-level observations from 1999 census (1977-1998). Coefficient 0.111 (t=3.14, p=0.002). This is the first-stage fertility response.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Children born in auspicious years have more years of schooling, consistent with the 'wantedness' mechanism.
baseline_groups.notes: Table 4 Column 1. OLS regression of years of schooling on BorG with Sex, quadratic birth-year trend, month FE, and birthyr-clustered SE. N=6.6M individual-level observations from 1999 census. Coefficient 0.305 (t=2.43, p=0.015). Only 21 birth-year clusters.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Children born in auspicious years have different height outcomes (health effect of wantedness).
baseline_groups.notes: Table 4 Column 5 analog. WLS regression of Height on BorG with Sex, quadratic birth-year trend, month FE, survey weights, and birthyr-clustered SE. N=57,592 from VNHS. Coefficient -1.78 (t=-2.92, p=0.004). Negative sign is counterintuitive; the paper uses height-for-age z-scores (zanthro) which could not be exactly replicated. The raw height confounds age effects.

global_notes: This paper examines whether birth in a zodiac-auspicious year affects child outcomes in Vietnam. Three distinct outcome domains are tested: cohort fertility (N=22 year-level), education (N=6.6M individual-level), and health/height (N=57K individual-level). Key vulnerability: all main results are critically sensitive to the quadratic birth-year trend specification. With a linear trend only, effects vanish across all three outcomes. Education inference relies on only 21 birth-year clusters. The treatment decomposition reveals effects are driven by boy-auspicious years, not the gender-matched mechanism the paper emphasizes. 93 total specifications.
